Package View_Controller

Class AddProduct_ViewController

  • java.lang.Object
    • View_Controller.AddProduct_ViewController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class AddProduct_ViewController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    FXML Controller class for the add product view, has bounds and format checking for input and makes user confirm cancel A runtime error I encountered in this controller class was in the changeScreen method. The FXMLLoader failed due to a misspelled filename, I corrected this by catching an exception caused by a failed FXMLLoader and presenting a error message to the user with instructions. A compatible feature that could be added to this view is the ability to mulit-select parts in the all parts table and add them all to the associated parts list

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      AddProduct_ViewController()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addPartToList()
      used to add a part to the list of the products associated parts, also checks if a part is selected and presents and error message if it is not
      void addProduct​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      adds created product to inventory, catches multiple Number Formate Exceptions and displays error message to user
      void cancelProduct​(javafx.event.ActionEvent E)
      Asks user if they are sure they want to cancel the product creation and if they choose yes this method will exit the current screen and not add any product to the inventory
      void fillTable()
      fills the Table Views with inventory data, allow for ease of table fills for future updates
      void initialize​(java.net.URL url, java.util.ResourceBundle rb)
      Initializes the controller class, and sets the new product ID
      void reFillTables()
      used to re-fill the Table Views in order to reflect any changes made by the user, allows for ease of use for future updates
      void removePartFromList()
      used to remove a part to the list of associated parts, also checks if a part is selected and presents and error message if it is not
      void searchPart()
      Sorts the All Parts Table View, alerts user if there is no part that matches search also catches Number Format Exception
